page_content:
In 2021 and 2022, we made significant progress in advancing our 
pipeline, accelerating patient access to lifesaving medicines, and 
identifying better medicines. 
• In September 2021, the U.S. FDA granted accelerated approval for 
TIVDAK to treat adult patients who have advanced cervical cancer 
with disease progression on or after chemotherapy.
• In April 2022, we announced the European Commission approval of 
PADCEV as monotherapy for the treatment of adult patients with 
locally advanced or metastatic urothelial cancer (la/mUC) who have 
previously received a platinum-containing chemotherapy and a 
PD-1/L1 inhibitor.
• In June 2022, we presented data from the phase 3 ECHELON-1 
clinical trial demonstrating a statistically significant improvement in 
overall survival in newly diagnosed patients with advanced Hodgkin 
lymphoma following treatment with ADCETRIS in combination with 
chemotherapy. Positive event-free survival data for a phase 3 study 
in pediatric patients with advanced Hodgkin lymphoma were also 
presented in June 2022 which could potentially broaden the 
existing label for the medicine.
• In July 2022, we presented data from the phase 2 MOUNTAINEER 
study evaluating TUKYSA in combination with trastuzumab for 
patients with previously treated HER2-positive colorectal cancer. 
We recently submitted a supplemental New Drug Application for 
potential accelerated U.S. FDA approval.
• In September 2022, we presented results from cohort K of the 
phase 1b/2 EV-103 trial for patients with first-line metastatic 
urothelial cancer who are ineligible for cisplatin-containing 
chemotherapy. We plan to submit a supplemental Biologics 
License Application under the U.S. FDA’s accelerated approval 
pathway in 2022.
• Advanced a deep and broad early pipeline of novel targeted 
therapies into first-in-human trials.
• Continued multiple strategic collaborations and partnerships, 
including with Astellas, Genmab, Merck, RemeGen, Sanofi, and 
Takeda, to advance the global availability of our products. Programs and Initiatives
